title: My Pixel 2 started buzzing in my back pocket. Now stuck with Slot Unbootable
content:
The phone is 1,5 year old. It has not been tampered with, everything is original. I have dropped it a few times.

It's not in developer mode.

I would like to enter recovery mode to restore it but it fails with slot unbootable (boot-slot: b). Because of this it is not much i can do. 

I haven't been able to get the device to show up when using adb devices. I've had the latest system update hanging around for a while without installing it. And my concern is that it is that installation that somehow has failed.

Detailed description of steps that i've tried:

Pixel 2 status:
Developer Options, USB Debugging: Disabled
Boot-Slot: b
Secure Boot: Yes
Device State: locked

Trying to enter download or recovery mode:
Download Mode: "Operation denied"
Recovery Mode: "Error: Slot Unbootable: Load Error"

Trying Fastboot:
fastboot flashing unlock -> FAILED (remote: 'Flashing Unlock is not allowed')
fastboot flashing get_unlock_ability -> (bootloader) get_unlock_ability: 0

You cannot unlock the bootloader if you haven't enabled Allow OEM Unlock in Developer options.  
When it's not possible to unlock i'm not able to flash using fastboot.

Trying to change Boot-slot:
fastboot --set-active=a -> FAILED (remote: 'Slot Change is not allowed in Lock State')

Trying ADB:
Manually flashing the factory image(using the full OTA variant since the bootloader is locked):
ADB and OTA does not work because Recovery Mode does not work and USB Debugging is disabled.

So i've pretty much run out of options :(
Thankful for any help!
